configuration.name: commonCOWorkflowsSettings
configuration.description: A configuration file with settings for all COWorkflows configuration files.

cvalue.name: sampleCol
cvalue.description: Metadata column defining sets of FASTQs belonging to the same sample type (tumor_01, etc.). Default: Sample. Default if undefined: Error!

cvalue.name: markCol
cvalue.description: Metadata column defining sets of FASTQs pooled for marking. Marking only happens within the same sample. Default: Library. Default if undefined: 1 Library per merged BAM.

cvalue.name: datasetCol
cvalue.description: Metadata column defining the datasets (e.g. patient ID). Default: PID

cvalue.name: readLayoutCol
cvalue.description: Metadata column defining the read layout. Usually paired, single, or mate_pair. For 'mate_pair' paired-end reads are reverse complemented (by some older workflow variant). Default: ReadLayout. Default if undefined: paired.

cvalue.name: runCol
cvalue.description: Metadata column defining the name of the run (e.g. run160126_ST-E00350_0017_AHKGFNCCXX). Default: Run

cvalue.name: mateCol
cvalue.description: Metadata column mapping FASTQ file to read numbers. Allowed values are 1, 2. If undefined single-end sequencing is assumed, unless readLayout==paired, in which case Roddy will warn you. Default: Mate. Default if undefined: If undefined and paired-end or mate-pair sequencing are set, matching FASTQs are allowed to differ by only a single number (1,2) and automatically identified.

cvalue.name: fileCol
cvalue.description: Metadata column specifying the FASTQ file to use as input. Default: SequenceFile. Default if undefined: Error.

cvalue.name: metadataTableColumnIDs
cvalue.description: Column names used internally, such as 'datasetCol' or 'fileCol'. The order of mandatory columns in here determines the priority of the column, not the expected column order in the input file (which can be arbitrary). Higher- priority values (left) may have to have unique values in the input metadata table, if lower priority columns (right) are selected to be unique. E.g. when selecting a value for mergeCol (e.g. a Sample), the datasetCol needs to be unique as well (e.g. the patient ID). However, these restrictions are may depend on the workflow and is implemented on the JVM level (Java or Groovy).
